eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils

Class ReverseConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils.ReverseConfiguration

  • public final class ReverseConfiguration
extends java.lang.Object
    Parser of user-specified configuration files for reconstructing records from an RDF graph (Reverse Transformation).
    Version:
    1.8
    Author:
    Kostas Patroumpas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int batch_size
      Default number of entities (i.e., records) to process in each batch of the reverse transformation before writing them to file.
      java.lang.String defaultLang
      Default language specification tag for string literals.
      char delimiter
      Delimiter character for attribute values in the output CSV file.
      java.lang.String encoding
      Encoding used for strings.
      java.lang.String inputFiles
      Path to file(s) containing input RDF dataset(s).
      (package private) Assistant myAssistant 
      java.lang.String outputFile
      Path to the output file that will contain all resulting records.
      java.lang.String outputFormat
      Format of output data file.
      private java.lang.String path
      Path to a properties file containing all parameters used in the reverse transformation.
      char quote
      Quote character to be used for strings in the output CSV file.
      java.lang.String serialization
      Input RDF serialization.
      java.lang.String sourceCRS
      Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of geometries in the input RDF triples.
      java.lang.String sparqlFile
      Path to a user-specified SELECT query in SPARQL that will retrieve results from the RDF graph(s).
      java.lang.String targetCRS
      Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of the output dataset.
      java.lang.String tmpDir
      Path to a directory where intermediate files may be temporarily written during reverse transformation.

      Constructor of a ReverseConfiguration object.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      private void buildConfiguration()
      Loads the reverse configuration from a properties file.

    • Field Detail

      • myAssistant

        Assistant myAssistant

      • outputFormat

        public java.lang.String outputFormat
        Format of output data file. Supported formats: SHAPEFILE, CSV.

      • path

        private java.lang.String path
        Path to a properties file containing all parameters used in the reverse transformation.

      • inputFiles

        public java.lang.String inputFiles
        Path to file(s) containing input RDF dataset(s). Multiple input files (of exactly the same serialization and ontology) can be specified, separating them by ';' in order to activate multiple concurrent threads for their reverse transformation.

      • outputFile

        public java.lang.String outputFile
        Path to the output file that will contain all resulting records.

      • sparqlFile

        public java.lang.String sparqlFile
        Path to a user-specified SELECT query in SPARQL that will retrieve results from the RDF graph(s). This query should conform with the underlying ontology of the input RDF triples.

      • tmpDir

        public java.lang.String tmpDir
        Path to a directory where intermediate files may be temporarily written during reverse transformation.

      • serialization

        public java.lang.String serialization
        Input RDF serialization. Supported formats: RDF/XML (default), RDF/XML-ABBREV, N-TRIPLES, TURTLE (or TTL), N3.

      • defaultLang

        public java.lang.String defaultLang
        Default language specification tag for string literals.

      • delimiter

        public char delimiter
        Delimiter character for attribute values in the output CSV file. Mandatory for CSV output; ignored otherwise.

      • quote

        public char quote
        Quote character to be used for strings in the output CSV file. Mandatory for CSV output; ignored otherwise.

      • encoding

        public java.lang.String encoding
        Encoding used for strings. Default encoding: UTF-8.

      • sourceCRS

        public java.lang.String sourceCRS
        Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of geometries in the input RDF triples. If omitted, geometries are assumed in WGS84 reference system (EPSG:4326). Example: EPSG:4326

      • targetCRS

        public java.lang.String targetCRS
        Spatial reference system (EPSG code) of the output dataset. If omitted, the georeference of the RDF geometries will be retained (i.e., no reprojection of coordinates will take place). Example: EPSG:4326

      • batch_size

        public int batch_size
        Default number of entities (i.e., records) to process in each batch of the reverse transformation before writing them to file.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ReverseConfiguration

        public ReverseConfiguration(java.lang.String path)
        Constructor of a ReverseConfiguration object.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to a properties file containing all parameters to be used in the transformation.

    • Method Detail

      • buildConfiguration

        private void buildConfiguration()
        Loads the reverse configuration from a properties file.

      • initializeParameters

        private void initializeParameters(java.util.Properties properties)
        Initializes all the parameters for the reverse transformation.
        Parameters:
        properties - All properties as specified in the configuration file.
